description: Android Weekly Updates Follow us on BlueSky We're there as well! Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Multi-Layered Mobile App Protection Attackers constantly find ways to reverse engineer, tamper with, or clone apps, putting sensitive data and revenue streams at risk. Join our webinar to unlock insights into how a multi-layered protection approach adapts with every build to neutralize mobile app threats. Register now. Getting Started with CameraX in Jetpack Compose Jolanda Verhoef shows how to integrate the camera-compose APIs in your app and some of the delightful UI experiences that integration with Compose unlocks. How modifiers order affects Compose UI appearance Marcin Moskała explains with clear examples how Compose UI modifiers work. Sponsored Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! FilterChip Dropdown selector in Jetpack Compose Manpreet Kunnath creates a FilterChip dropdown selector in Jetpack Compose. Top 3 Most Common Animations You Can Use in Your Jetpack Compose Project Enhance your app’s user experience with Dobri Kostadinov's simple and effective animation techniques in Jetpack Compose. Tap to focus: Mastering CameraX Transformations in Jetpack Compose Jolanda Verhoef teaches using the Compose gesture system, graphics, and coroutines to implement a visual tap-to-focus. Understanding SOLID Principles with Kotlin Examples Ignacio Carrión looks at how the SOLID principles form the foundation for building robust and scalable software. Android Dynamic Animated SVGs (with Lottie Dynamic Properties) Paul Blundell explains Lottie Dynamic Properties, a way of controlling different parts of your animation at runtime. Compose Design Systems: Have a Plan Mark Murphy considers using Material's design system for Compuse UI versus building your own. (Trying to) take notes from the lock screen Thomas Künneth examines the NOTES role in Android 14 which supports the note-taking feature and increases productivity of Android tablets. Mastering Kotlin Coroutine Channels in Android: From Basics to Advanced Patterns Ioannis Anifantakis shows how using the channel type that suits your use case helps to create robust, scalable Android apps free from callback spaghetti. Client is King! Kotlin Multiplatform architecture for native UI — Part 1 In this first post, Benedict Pregler gives an overview of the cross-platform workflow architecture and what the API on the clients look like. Libraries & Code aspecto Aspecto is a grid layout that perfectly preserves each item's aspect ratio for the Jetpack Compose / Compose Multiplatform. News Building a better smart home Google is making it easier for developers to create amazing smart home experiences for users, and for those users to enjoy seamless connectivity and interoperability across all their devices. Build the future of home with Google Home APIs The Home APIs are now in Public Developer Beta for Android Videos & Podcasts Koin just Got Better! Configuration Navigation Simplified Koin just Got Better! Configuration Navigation Simplified Camera & Media | Spotlight Week To help you enhance Android Camera and Media experiences to be even more delightful for your users, this week we will be kicking off the Camera and Media Spotlight week! How to Encrypt DataStore On Android - Full Guide Philipp Lackner teaches how to encrypt the content of DataStore Preferences, for example to safely store authentication tokens. Media & Camera experiences | Android Build Time In this episode of Android Build Time, Christopher Cartland is joined by Caren Chang and Jordan de Hoog to discuss Media API insights. We fixed an inconsistency in Kotlin (non-local break & continue) Try the non-local break and continue feature today! Learn on how to enable it in Kotlin 2.1. What's new in Android Studio Ladybug Learn what's new in the stable release of Android Studio Ladybug Feature Drop (2024.2.2)!
